status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Roberta Wilkinson (2):work order closed by Alayna Beatty (3):work commencement by Neil Hauck (4):work planning by Neil Hauck (5):offer approved (6):offer submitted by Neil Hauck (7):sor submitted / draft by Neil Hauck

scope_of_work.problem: Following routine maintenance, specialist Service Report has identified a minor leak on Switchroom4 Stulz cooling unit and faulty Suction Transducers.
scope_of_work.scope: 1. Recover remaining refrigerant into suitable recovery cylinder.2. Lock off compressor to prevent it starting during pressure test. 3. Replace suction transducers. 4. Pressurise system, find leak and repair if possible.5. Providing it passes pressure leak test, evacuate system.6. Charge virgin refrigerant 7. Test and run unit 8. Complete paperwork and issue to client
scope_of_work.justification: Stulz cooling unit is required to maintain the temperature in Switchroom4, housing DC Critical A infrastructure services.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk to DC Critical A infrastructure services.

project_name: UPM-All Chiller leak repairs & remedial works -inc NRV's
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):offer submitted by Eliseo Treutel (2):sor submitted / draft by Eliseo Treutel

scope_of_work.notes: 1. Does not include any client contingency 2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Refrigeration leaks identified on Chiller system. PLC CPU batteries for Chillers 1, 2, 3, 4 and 6 requires replacing
scope_of_work.scope: Chiller 100663-6. Found Comp No.1 NRV passing therefore mechanical isolated the section and Tagged the valves. Compressor switched off via HMI. Found leak on both Filter drier flange gasket. This leak needs to be fixed as soon as possible & driers renewed.Chiller 100663-3 Found Comp No.3 NRV leaking therefore mechanical isolated the section and Tagged the valves.Chiller 100663-4 Found Comp No.3 NRV leaking therefore mechanical isolated the section and Tagged the valves. Recommend replacing the PLC CPU batteries for Chillers 1, 2, 3, 4 and 6. These will need to suit Q06UDEHCPU. This prevents the risk of PLC's losing their programmed software. When removing the old batteries for new the program will be lost and need to be reprogrammed remotely via a lap top Chiller No.5 checked over the chiller and found no OFN in the system.Recommending to charge 5 cylinders of OFN into the system.
scope_of_work.justification: A refrigerant leak can be dangerous and have serious consequences, including:Environmental impact: Direct emissions from a refrigerant leak can harm the environment. Flammable nature: A refrigerant leak can cause explosions and damage to systems.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: A refrigerant leak can be dangerous and have serious consequences, including:Environmental impact: Direct emissions from a refrigerant leak can harm the environment. Flammable nature: A refrigerant leak can cause explosions and damage to systems.

project_name: UPM-Phase 1 Chiller 3 Pressure Leak Test, Repair and Re-gas
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Roberta Wilkinson (2):work order closed by Jayme Feil (3):work commencement by Jayme Feil (4):work planning by Jayme Feil (5):offer approved (6):offer submitted by Jayme Feil (7):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes: 100kg of Refrigerant R134A has been allowed in this quotation to recharge unit to full charge 304kg
scope_of_work.problem: During the 6 month Chiller 3 was found to be operating short of refrigerant charge with evidence of refrigerant leakage
scope_of_work.scope: Recover the remaining charge of refrigerant to bottles, pressure test unit with oxygen free nitrogen, repair minor leaks, evacuate vessels to 4mbar, recharge unit and complete run tests
scope_of_work.justification: Fgas regulations require investigation and repairs to Chiller/DX units that have ozone depleting gas.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: In breach of the Fgas regulations

status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes: That the actuator is the root cause of the issue.
scope_of_work.problem: During the Generator 2 minor service and 1 hour load run in October, the generator ran on, failing to stop on command. On investigation the main actuator controlling fuel delivery to the unit is sticking, failing to shut off the fuel and thus the generator continues to run. In order to stop the unit the fuel delivery line had to be closed.
scope_of_work.scope: Replace main actuator and complete load runs, stop starts, to confirm correct operation
scope_of_work.justification: Generator 2 provides emergency power to the Phase 1 Building Services equipment in the event of a Mains Fail condition. These panels feed all critical equipment to maintain the DC HVAC within correct operating limits (chillers, pumps, cooling towers, sensible coolers)

project_name: UPM-Ph1A AHU Blue Box DX Replacement TEV & PLT
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes: 30 day validity so repair can be completed asap
scope_of_work.problem: During the 6 Month DX maintenance the Ph1A AHU Blue Box Unit 3 was found to be operating with a faulty thermostatic expansion valve and was short of refrigerant.
scope_of_work.scope: Recover gas charge, replace Unit 3 TEV, perform pressure leak test and vac test, recharge and complete running checks
scope_of_work.justification: Under FGas Regulations it is a requirement once aware of a system with evidence of refrigerant loss to repair ASAP

project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick Diesel Sprinkler Pump Repair/Replacement
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes: To replace existing Fire pump only with new and test upon completionIf further issues identified then a further project may be required in this event
scope_of_work.problem: The Diesel Sprinkler Pump at Kyndryl Warwick is currently in Manual only mode due to the pump burning out on run tests. The pump can be started manually in Emergency however we have been advised not to run this pump to prevent any further damage to the system. A New pump is required to get the system back into Automatic control
scope_of_work.scope: Existing pump to be stripped and removed from its location, new replacement pump to be moved into position using various lifting tackle equipment. Once new pump is into position the pump will be fixed into position and run to confirm correct operation before putting the system back into Automatic control
scope_of_work.justification: We currently do not have Automatic control of the Sprinkler System onsite, it is reliant on a manual start by the site Operations team, manual start sheets are located at various locations to enable the team to start in an Emergency situation however we are unsure how the pump will react in its current state. We would like to get the new pump installed so that we can get back to an Automatic control system
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: FM Global are currently being notified of the situation, if we do not replace then we would likely have our insurance premiums increase for the location. We also have a fire risk if the pump does not act as is required in the event of a real life Fire situation on site

project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick CSB AHU Supply Fan/Motor Repair
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes: The works detailed in the LSQ is the works covered to be complete, any additional works will require additional funding
scope_of_work.problem: The PH1 CSB AHU Supply Fan has failed due to age and use. The fan bearing have dropped alongside the internal motor bearings and caster feet. CSB AHU is currently isolated due to this issue, suites are being monitored for Humidity and Temperature. At present we are maintaining however is snap cold/hot spells the areas struggle to maintain the humidity/temperature control. CSB currently has the majority of the DC load within it alongside our biggest client at the location
scope_of_work.scope: Provide necessary RAMS and agree with customer.Remove all guards and Vee beltsDismantle motor and carry out visual inspectionSupply and fit new bearings bearings and reassemble motorRemove plumber block-bearing assembliesClean and polish shaftSupply and fit new bearingsSupply and fit new belts and guardingRun test with customer witness where applicable and obtain signatory on site report sheet.
scope_of_work.justification: AHU is required to maintain Temperature and Humidity control, this ensure the the IT equipment within the area served remains online and at its optimum
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: The potential for IT Equipment to fail if Temperature/Humidity is not maintained within the area which could eventually cause an outage of IT services

project_name: UPM-Ph1A Generators FGH oil and filter replacement
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes: LSQ open for acceptance for 90 days.
scope_of_work.problem: Following the site generator minor service visits and 1 hour runs on load in November, Ph1A FG&H generator oil sample results reveal oil degradation and some fuel dilution and it is an OEM recommendation to replace the oil and oil filters.
scope_of_work.scope: Replace Generators FG&H engine oil and oil filters, load runs and oil samples.
scope_of_work.justification: Oil degrades over time and results in loss of engine cooling capability and increases the risk of damage to the engine and additional business risk. Oil samples performed at 6 monthly intervals under the conditioned based monitoring maintenance regime. Oil last replaced 2020.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk of damage to the engines and additional business risk.

project_name: UPM-DRUPS loadbank for January 2025 Quarterly load run
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):cancelled by Bilal (2):sor submitted / draft by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.problem: DRUPS is due it's next quarterly load run at >35% load in January 2025 as per best practice. Current business load does not provide enough load so the hire of a 600kW load bank is required.
scope_of_work.scope: Hire and connection, disconnection of 600kW load bank with inline 1250A MCCB issue of PTWs/ICs Delivery of load bank.
scope_of_work.justification: Maintain the DRUPS generator reliability and prevent wet stacking of generators due to low load conditions.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Increased risk of generator failure, reduction of DRUPS reliability.
